intro: Patrinia diversifolia, commonly known as Chinese violet or broadleaf patrinia, is a perennial herb native to East Asia. It features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy and have a distinctive bluish-green hue. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of white to purple, arranged in clusters at the ends of its stems. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forests and along stream banks. Patrinia diversifolia is valued in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
